modName: Game of Thrones Cover Main Menu Theme Replacement
summary: Replaces the main menu theme of Skyrim with independent covers of the Game of Thrones opening theme music.
descriptionHtml:
Violin/Metal Mashup Cover:

\"Originally composed by Ramin Djawadi for the Game of Thrones television series on HBO, this version of the song displays the combined works of violinist Jason Yang (http://www.youtube.com/jasonyangviolin) and musician Roger Lima of White Noise Lab (http://www.wnlab.com). Their covers were mixed together by Film Director and Cinematographer Paolo Dy (http://www.paolody.com) to create this unique, gripping, and dramatic masterpiece.\"

I absolutely adore this collaborative cover of the Game of Thrones intro theme. If you\'re anything like me you rarely leave the main menu open long enough for the music to start playing, but I felt it was really nice to have it in there as I feel it\'s very appropriate for Skyrim.

Preview: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0OWQXQgHgq8&feature=related

Violin Cover:

\"Originally composed by Ramin Djawadi for the Game of Thrones television series on HBO, this version of the song displays the beautiful playing of violinist Jason Yang (http://www.youtube.com/jasonyangviolin), who recorded himself playing each part of the song using a violin and electric violin with no accompaniment. The end result is a deep, haunting, emotional piece which resonates well with the heart of Skyrim, and without any of that newfangled metal nonsense the youngins are always going on about.\" XD

By request! :)

Preview: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1yydcG9woWA&feature=related

To install, pick one file from the two choices (Violin/Metal or Violin). Simply unpackage the RAR file and drop the /music/ folder into the Data folder. You can find this folder where Skyrim was installed.

[b]*** PLEASE NOTE: I will not be uploading the original Game of Thrones intro as a replacement file because it would constitute a violation of the Skyrim Nexus upload agreement. HOWEVER, I will create and hold on to the file and will e-mail it to you if you send me a private message via the forums. If you\'re interested in doing it yourself, there are instructions for creating .xwm files in the readme. Please be forewarned that this is a pretty complicated process. ***[/b]
author: Blankstate
